dataIdInfo.idAbs: With the Commit Stream Network tool, the user selects a specific representation of a stream network. That representation can be based on specific criteria (or combination of criterias), such as a custom spatial extent. By "committing" that network to a GNAT Riverscapes project, that stream network is the basis for a new realization, upon which all subsequent analysis are performed. Each Riverscapes project can have multiple realizations, and each realization can have multiple analyses. Each new realization must be created by committing a different version of the stream network.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Kelly Whitehead, Jesse Langdon, South Fork Research, Inc.

tool.name: CommitRealization

param.name: projectXML
param.dialogReference: The Riverscapes project XML file (named "project.rs.xml") which stores all relevant information about the GNAT project.

param.name: realization
param.dialogReference: The name for the realization that will be created upon commital of the stream network to the project. Each realization name should be unique.

param.name: InputFCStreamNetwork
param.dialogReference: The stream network polyline feature class which will be commited to the GNAT project.

param.name: reachIDfield
param.dialogReference: An attribute field with a unique identifier value for each stream reach feature in the input stream network polyline feature class.

param.name: tblNetwork
param.dialogReference: A network topology table, preferably built using the Build Network Topology Table tool, found in GNAT > Main > Step 1- Stream Network Preparation.

tool.summary: With the Commit Stream Network tool, the user selects a specific representation of a stream network. That representation can be based on specific criteria (or combination of criterias), such as a custom spatial extent. By "committing" that network to a GNAT Riverscapes project, that stream network is the basis for a new realization, upon which all subsequent analysis are performed. Each Riverscapes project can have multiple realizations, and each realization can have multiple analyses. Each new realization must be created by committing a different version of the stream network.
